Key Match Events: Trae Young hit a buzzer-beating 3-pointer from beyond the half-court line to give the Atlanta Hawks a 124-121 victory over the Utah Jazz
Dyson Daniels added 16 points, seven assists, and six rebounds for the Hawks
Lauri Markkanen made a season-high eight 3-pointers and scored a season-best 35 points for Utah
Collin Sexton added 24 points and Walker Kessler finished with 21 points and 10 rebounds
Utah scored on five straight possessions and took a 114-113 lead on back-to-back dunks from Kessler
Young hit a step-back 3-pointer to put Atlanta back in front, and fed Hunter for another go-ahead 3 with 1:57 left
Post-Match Reflections: Young's heave at the buzzer snapped the Hawks' skid and was the team's fifth in its last eight games
Miscellaneous Highlights: Atlanta used a balanced attack with seven players scoring in double figures
Utah fell behind by 14 points in the first quarter and 16 in the second before battling back both times and making it a one-possession game by halftime
The Hawks finish a six-game road swing at Phoenix on Thursday
The Jazz host Miami on Thursday
